content.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy expects the company’s workforce to shrink over the next few years as AI increases efficiency, though employees who embrace the technology are likely to be well-positioned.
A sharp decline in restaurant spending in May suggests that trade tensions may be influencing consumer habits, though it remains too early to determine the full impact.
In June, Senate Republicans unveiled a sweeping plan to overhaul Medicaid, with analysts warning it could cause more coverage losses and hospital strain than the House proposal passed last month.
Trade wars continue to create a stop-and-start effect on the economy, with May’s retail sales report underscoring the potential risks to U.S. growth.
The euro still lags the U.S. dollar and gold in global reserves, prompting ECB President Christine Lagarde to outline how the currency’s role might be strengthened.
Following AMD’s AI chip announcements last week, analysts are increasingly optimistic about the company’s prospects, and its stock may now be reflecting that momentum.

outlook: Based on these points, the short-term outlook for the S&P 500 over the next week appears to be neutral with a slight upward bias, driven by optimism in tech and tempered by macroeconomic and policy concerns.
